verbose_text: Here, we have determined that overexpression of CK1gamma2 inhibited cell proliferation and growth of osteosarcoma cells by at least partially down-regulating the IRS4 protein level and subsequently impairing Akt activation in vitro and in vivo, indicating that CK1gamma2 may act as a tumor suppressor in osteosarcoma by negatively regulating the IRS4 / Akt pathway.
evidence: CK1gamma2 inhibited cell proliferation and growth of osteosarcoma cells by at least partially down-regulating the IRS4 protein level and subsequently impairing Akt
